intro: Thesium souardii, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming foliage and showy, star-shaped inflorescences. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Thesium souardii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
